title: When to invest in new acquisition channels | Adam Grenier (Uber, MasterClass)
key_insights: Only 5% of emerging channels work, so evaluate channel DNA, company fit, and customer overlap before investing
Start by assuming you no longer have product-market fit in changing economic conditions - your entire customer base may have changed
Growth CMOs need to operate like product managers with data-driven iteration and experimentation across all marketing functions
Depression vs burnout can be distinguished by motivation patterns - burnout affects work energy while depression impacts all activities
The 'Yes, and...' principle from improv creates better collaboration by building on ideas rather than rejecting them
Early adopters are often drastically different from broad audiences - map out what signals indicate broader market fit
Marketing and product should be married at the hip in modern product-driven companies, not separate functions
Emerging channels work best when their strengths align with customer needs and company goals
topics_discussed: Framework for evaluating emerging acquisition channels
Company readiness for new channel experiments
TikTok, Clubhouse, VR, and OTT advertising opportunities
Growth CMO vs traditional CMO differences
Mental health awareness in startup environments
Crossing the chasm from early adopters to mainstream
Building transparent friend networks for mental health support
memorable_quotes: Start by assuming you no longer have product market fit, because you had product market fit in a different market. It's a different market now, so you have to start over.
One of the biggest pieces of advice... your entire customer base changed, not just the next 10% of customers that you're looking for.
If you as a marketing leader aren't being iterative and thoughtful about things... you'll get eaten alive.
recommended_for: marketing leaders transitioning to growth roles
marketing professionals interested in mental health
anyone exploring career transitions in marketing/growth
summary: Adam Grenier shares frameworks for evaluating emerging acquisition channels and discusses the evolution of marketing leadership toward a more product-integrated, data-driven Growth CMO role. The conversation also addresses important mental health topics including recognizing burnout vs depression and building support systems in high-pressure startup environments.
